channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Potholes and the Bickley roundabout on Bickley park road, 31st January
item.description:
The road from Bickley to queen Mary’s is full of potholes both ways it’s like going down a country road but dangerous. The roundabout on Bickley park Road is completely destroyed and will kill tyres. This is one of the busiest roads in Bromley, the road needs to be resurfaced properly rather than filling which last for a couple go months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakleigh Park Avenue, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scum still don't understand what a bin is, 31st January
item.description:
I'm sick and tired of having to report this and you continue to do nothing to prevent it from happening again and again. Unfortunately we're at work when this is happening so can never catch them in the act which is why I keep telling you to put CCTV somewhere so they can be caught and issue fines.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsworth Close, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath needs a sweep, 31st January
item.description:
Footpath needs to have a good sweep. The enterance barriers are the real issue where there is a build up of wet leaves. These can cause damp in the garage next to the alleyway. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, St Laurence Close, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Fly Tipping Havil street flats, 31st January
item.description:
This is a fire hazard. Fly tipping & rubbish on ground & first floor flats. Image 1 - Friday morning g Image 2&3 - reported three times now no action

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Havil Street, Camberwell, Greater London

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Dumped car for Sale, 31st January
item.description:
I watched this car park up here in front of me on the 30th December 2025, a month later this car is still parked here. The person does not live here but has left his car to try and sell it. With the new double yellow lines along Hayes lane parking has now become difficult for residents that live here. My wife has just had an operation and we find it difficult to park outside and this car js not helping. It hasn’t moved in over a month.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 149, Hayes Lane, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
